description: A skier was left thanking his lucky stars after a leap into the unknown (pictured) resulted in seven broken ribs and a collapsed lung in the Canadian ski resort of Whistler Blackcomb.
title: Skier shows moment he broke 7 ribs in Canada
title_page: Skier shows moment he broke 7 ribs in Canada | Daily Mail Online
text:
A skier was lucky to escape with his life after a leap into the unknown resulted in him landing on razor-sharp rocks.
The grisly accident, captured on camera last year, resulted in seven broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
The dramatic footage was captured on the man's Go-Pro camera, which was thought to be lost after the accident but remarkably survived the rocks and snow to surface four months later.
In the video one of the skiers friends can be seen to stop just before the jump, as if realising it's dangers
Posting online, the skier said: 'I was a little too excited and I made the mistake of airing off this roller that I thought looked OK from the top.
'I posted this video in hopes that somebody out there could learn from my mistake - always check your landings before you jump!
'I consider myself lucky to get off as easy as I did.'
The skier realises the extent of his mistake the moment after he launches into the air
The Go-Pro captures him tumbling to the ground before cutting out
The accident happened in Whistler Blackcomb ski resort in British Columbia, one of the largest ski resorts in North America.
The resort also hosted the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics.
In his online post, the skier added in a 'big thanks' to the Blackcomb ski patrol who rescued and took him to hospital.
